isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - SLEEPER LIGHTING AND ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - SHORE POWER WIRING (08WET) WITH INVERTER (08WES)

svcproc.title: SHORE POWER WIRING (08WET) WITH INVERTER (08WES)
svcproc.para: With the DC/AC inverter sleeper panel on/off switch in the on position, power flows from battery stud (+), through fuse 200A, through circuit RD, to the DC/AC inverter power DC+ connector. The ground path is from the DC/AC inverter power DC- connector, through circuit BK, to the ground battery stud (-) and the frame rail ground. The DC/AC inverter 110 VAC output, flows to the AC sockets, through the 15A circuit breaker in the load center outlet (left under bunk storage area), to the bunk bulkhead outlet, to the TV/VCR cabinet outlet and to the left side utility cabinet outlet (W/72" sleeper only). The 110 VAC circuits wiring, uses the three wires, colored white/black/green, to the outlets. The TV/Telephone connector, receives AC power from the bunk bulkhead outlet, through the telephone wire. The TV/Telephone connector, receives TV signal from the TV input channel A/B switch, through the TV coax cable. The DC/AC inverter 110 VAC input, flows to the shore power 110 VAC connector.
